name: Tulsi (Holy Basil)
description: Tulsi is a sacred plant in India, used for its medicinal and spiritual value. Thrives in sunlight with regular watering.

careInstructions.Light: Tulsi grows best in bright, direct sunlight. Place it where it gets at least 5–6 hours of sunlight daily. Indoor pots should be near a sunny window or balcony.
careInstructions.Watering: Keep the soil evenly moist but not soggy. In summer, water daily in small amounts; in winter, water every 2–3 days. Always check the top layer of soil before watering.
careInstructions.Soil: Tulsi thrives in well-drained, loamy soil enriched with compost. Regular addition of organic matter keeps it healthy. Avoid clay soil as it holds too much water.
careInstructions.Temperature: The ideal range is 15–35°C. Protect from frost and cold drafts in winter. During hot summers, provide light shade in the afternoon.
careInstructions.Humidity: It prefers moderate humidity. Mist the leaves occasionally in dry climates to prevent leaf dryness. Good airflow helps prevent fungal infections.
careInstructions.Pests: Prone to aphids, whiteflies, and spider mites. Neem oil spray is effective against pests. Overwatering may lead to fungal root rot.

name: Neem Tree
description: Known as the 'village pharmacy', Neem offers many medicinal benefits. Grows easily in Indian climates with minimal care.

careInstructions.Light: Neem requires full sunlight throughout the day. It does not grow well in shaded areas. Plant it in an open space where it gets maximum exposure.
careInstructions.Watering: Young trees need regular watering until established. Mature trees require very little water and can survive drought conditions. Avoid overwatering as it causes root issues.
careInstructions.Soil: Grows best in sandy to loamy soil with good drainage. It can tolerate poor and dry soils. Adding organic manure improves growth.
careInstructions.Temperature: Best suited for hot climates between 21–40°C. It is drought-tolerant but cannot survive frost. Protect saplings during cold months.
careInstructions.Humidity: Neem tolerates low humidity and dry conditions. It thrives in semi-arid to tropical climates. Excessive humidity can promote fungal issues.
careInstructions.Pests: Generally pest resistant but can be attacked by scale insects. Regular pruning and keeping soil dry prevents pest growth. Neem oil also works as its natural defense.

name: Money Plant
description: A lucky indoor plant said to bring prosperity. Needs indirect light and occasional watering.

careInstructions.Light: Thrives in bright, indirect light. Avoid harsh sunlight as it may burn leaves. It can also survive in low-light conditions indoors.
careInstructions.Watering: Water once a week, allowing the soil to partially dry between watering. In winter, reduce frequency to avoid root rot. Yellow leaves indicate overwatering.
careInstructions.Soil: Well-drained potting mix with peat moss or cocopeat works best. Ensure the pot has drainage holes. Avoid heavy soil that retains water.
careInstructions.Temperature: Best growth occurs between 18–30°C. It cannot tolerate frost or very low temperatures. Protect from cold drafts indoors.
careInstructions.Humidity: Moderate to high humidity helps lush growth. Mist the leaves occasionally in dry climates. Keep away from very dry air near heaters.
careInstructions.Pests: Mealybugs and aphids are common pests. Wipe leaves with mild soap solution if infested. Avoid waterlogging to prevent fungal infections.

name: Hibiscus
description: Produces large, bright flowers. Common in Indian gardens. Needs sunlight and regular watering.

careInstructions.Light: Hibiscus requires full sun for healthy flowering. At least 6 hours of direct light daily is best. In partial shade, fewer flowers bloom.
careInstructions.Watering: Water 2–3 times per week, keeping the soil moist but not soggy. Increase watering in hot summers. Avoid letting soil completely dry.
careInstructions.Soil: Prefers loamy, fertile soil rich in organic compost. Soil should be well-draining. Adding mulch helps retain moisture.
careInstructions.Temperature: Ideal range is 15–32°C. Protect from frost and cold weather. During peak summer, afternoon shade prevents leaf burn.
careInstructions.Humidity: Moderate humidity is ideal. In very dry conditions, misting helps prevent bud drop. Ensure airflow to avoid fungal infections.
careInstructions.Pests: Vulnerable to aphids, whiteflies, and mealybugs. Regular pruning and neem oil spray help control pests. Keep soil clean of debris.

name: Curry Leaf Plant
description: Essential in Indian cooking. Grows well in pots with sunlight and moderate watering.

careInstructions.Light: Needs at least 5–6 hours of direct sunlight daily. Grows best in bright outdoor conditions. Can also adapt to balcony sunlight.
careInstructions.Watering: Water 2–3 times weekly in summer. Allow topsoil to dry slightly before watering. Avoid overwatering as it causes yellowing leaves.
careInstructions.Soil: Well-drained sandy or loamy soil works best. Adding organic compost promotes growth. Avoid heavy clay soil.
careInstructions.Temperature: Ideal range is 20–35°C. Sensitive to frost, so protect in winters. Can withstand Indian summer heat.
careInstructions.Humidity: Prefers moderate humidity. Dry air may cause leaf drop. Occasional misting helps in dry climates.
careInstructions.Pests: Aphids, scales, and spider mites may attack leaves. Neem oil spray is effective. Regular pruning reduces pest infestations.

name: Marigold
description: Widely used in festivals and rituals. Grows best in full sunlight with minimal care.

careInstructions.Light: Marigolds grow best in full sun. They need at least 6 hours of sunlight daily. Shady conditions reduce flowering.
careInstructions.Watering: Water daily during flowering season. Avoid overwatering as it causes root rot. Ensure soil is moist but not waterlogged.
careInstructions.Soil: Loamy, sandy, well-drained soil is best. Adding compost improves flower yield. Avoid overly rich soil which delays blooming.
careInstructions.Temperature: Ideal range is 15–30°C. Marigolds tolerate heat but not frost. Best suited for tropical and subtropical climates.
careInstructions.Humidity: Low to moderate humidity is preferred. Excess humidity can cause fungal problems. Good airflow keeps plants healthy.
careInstructions.Pests: Prone to spider mites and aphids. Regular monitoring and organic sprays help. Deadheading flowers prevents pest buildup.

name: Banana Plant
description: Commonly grown for fruits and leaves. Needs warm climate and regular watering.

careInstructions.Light: Banana plants need full sun throughout the day. At least 8 hours of sunlight is necessary. Avoid planting in shade.
careInstructions.Watering: Requires heavy watering, especially in summer. Keep soil consistently moist. Avoid stagnant water to prevent root diseases.
careInstructions.Soil: Prefers fertile, well-drained soil rich in organic matter. Adding compost and manure boosts growth. Sandy loam soil works best.
careInstructions.Temperature: Ideal temperature is 20–38°C. Cannot tolerate frost or cold weather. Protect young plants during winter.
careInstructions.Humidity: High humidity (50–70%) is required for healthy growth. In dry climates, frequent misting helps. Maintain moisture around roots.
careInstructions.Pests: Banana weevils, nematodes, and aphids may attack. Use organic pesticides and maintain soil hygiene. Remove infected leaves quickly.

name: Aloe Vera
description: Medicinal plant with healing properties. Requires sunlight and little water.

careInstructions.Light: Aloe Vera thrives in bright sunlight. Place near a sunny window or outdoors. It can tolerate partial shade but grows slower.
careInstructions.Watering: Water once every 2 weeks. Allow soil to dry completely before watering again. Overwatering causes root rot.
careInstructions.Soil: Requires sandy, well-draining soil. Cactus or succulent potting mix is ideal. Avoid soil that holds excess moisture.
careInstructions.Temperature: Best growth occurs between 15–30°C. Cannot tolerate frost. In very hot summers, provide light shade.
careInstructions.Humidity: Prefers dry conditions and low humidity. High humidity may cause fungal issues. Ensure good airflow indoors.
careInstructions.Pests: Scale insects and mealybugs may attack. Wipe leaves with alcohol-dipped cotton to remove them. Avoid excess moisture to prevent rot.

name: Mint
description: Mint is a fast-growing herb with refreshing aroma and taste. Commonly used in teas and cooking, it thrives in partial sunlight and moist soil.

careInstructions.Light: Mint grows well in partial sunlight or light shade. Too much direct sun may burn the leaves. Indoors, place near east-facing windows.
careInstructions.Watering: Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy. Water more frequently in summer. Do not allow soil to completely dry out.
careInstructions.Soil: Moist, nutrient-rich, well-drained soil is ideal. Adding compost boosts flavor and leaf production. Avoid dry, sandy soil.
careInstructions.Temperature: Best range is 15–30°C. Can tolerate mild cold but not frost. In hot summers, provide partial shade.
careInstructions.Humidity: Moderate to high humidity helps lush growth. Misting leaves helps during dry seasons. Good airflow prevents mildew.
careInstructions.Pests: Susceptible to aphids, spider mites, and whiteflies. Regular pruning and neem oil spray control infestations. Companion planting also keeps pests away.

name: Lavender
description: Lavender is known for its fragrant purple flowers and calming aroma. It grows best in sunny spots with well-drained soil.

careInstructions.Light: Lavender requires full sunlight to bloom well. Ensure at least 6–8 hours daily exposure. Avoid shaded areas as it reduces fragrance.
careInstructions.Watering: Water deeply but infrequently, once soil dries out. Overwatering causes root rot. In rainy seasons, reduce watering drastically.
careInstructions.Soil: Prefers sandy, well-drained soil. Adding gravel improves drainage. Avoid clay soil as it retains too much water.
careInstructions.Temperature: Ideal range is 12–30°C. Lavender tolerates mild cold but not heavy frost. Provide winter protection in colder regions.
careInstructions.Humidity: Low to moderate humidity is preferred. High humidity may cause fungal infections. Good airflow is essential.
careInstructions.Pests: Occasionally attacked by aphids and whiteflies. Use organic sprays if needed. Avoid damp conditions to prevent fungal problems.

name: Rosemary
description: Rosemary is a woody perennial herb with needle-like leaves. It is widely used in cooking and thrives in sunny, well-drained conditions.

careInstructions.Light: Rosemary thrives in full sunlight. It requires 6–8 hours of direct light daily. Indoors, place near a south-facing window.
careInstructions.Watering: Water once a week or when topsoil is dry. Avoid overwatering as it leads to root rot. Reduce watering in winter.
careInstructions.Soil: Sandy, well-drained soil works best. A slightly alkaline soil improves flavor. Ensure pot drainage holes are clear.
careInstructions.Temperature: Ideal temperature is 15–32°C. Sensitive to frost, so bring indoors during winter. Can tolerate moderate summer heat.
careInstructions.Humidity: Prefers low humidity conditions. Excess moisture in the air may cause fungal issues. Good airflow prevents diseases.
careInstructions.Pests: Prone to spider mites and aphids. Regular pruning helps avoid infestations. Neem oil or soap spray works well for control.
